reviewText: I hope more people will watch this.
DVD was what I expected. Thanks
It did a  wonderful job of explaining the tragedies of 1915 on the Armenian people and how they were able to overcome them and prosper in Lebanon.

I was born and raised in Anjar. The films brought back old memories and stories that were also told by my ancestors. It is very simple yet effective, However, I always find it hard to get interested in these kind of films unless you know the history or have connections. A more descriptive title may have peaked a lot of interest.

On the other hand, I applaud the film makers. Anjar is near and dear to my heart. The history of the heroic people of Musa Dagh who settled in Anjar should be told as it is captured in Franz Werfel's "Fourty Day's of Musa Dagh" novel.

it is about the Armenian genocide, as all the Armenian in the Turkish Empire were driven to death marches through a scorching desert under the viciousness of Turkish soldiers, one Armenian village decided to fight !! all what they needed was a miracle ( a big huge one) this is the story of this film
Very interesting documentary. Well done. People of Armenian descent appreciate the content because of the historical significance of the bravery and resilience of the people of Musa Dagh.
Beautiful job telling some important stories.
Great Documentary, very well prepared and presented.
